author: Oggang1255
body: Nvidia, msft, fortinet, palo alto networks, Mastercard, Visa

author: The_Folkhero
body: It has had a major run recently. In cybersecurity there is no clear cut discernable winner so the better best is to buy a basket of the better ones, which I do think FTNT is one of those along with Palo Alto Networks and Crowdstrike.

author: SteveSharpe
body:
I am in the industry, and CrowdStrike makes a good product, but endpoint security solutions seem to come and go in popularity all the time.  A few years ago the hot one was Carbon Black.  Now it's CrowdStrike with all the hype.

I suspect in a few years something new and better will emerge.  Cybersecurity is tough to invest in because it changes so rapidly.  Rather than invest in a point solution company, I'd recommend looking at a security company that is much more diverse like a Fortinet or Palo Alto Networks.

author: BigDickRetard69
body: FTNT

author: paranoidandroid59
body:
FedEx. UPS. Amazon. Walmart. Berkshire. Corning. Google. P&G. All resilient companies and have proven they aren’t going anywhere bc of Covid. 

I’ll add in Facebook. I hate the company but this is an election year and advertising spending is the only way candidates are getting in front of voters.
